alert.note: Alert for Tolland (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:05AM EST until January 11 at 8:39PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Hartford and Tolland. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of smaller rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across much of northern Connecticut. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Branch of the Park River and Burlington Brook. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill and Avon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
